content.question:
The temperature of a hot object that is cooling can be modeled by the function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>. Time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is measured in minutes since the object started cooling, and <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is measured in degrees Celsius (<math alttext="degree C"><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>). The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is an exponential decay function. 

It is known that the temperature of the object decreases <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> from time <math alttext="t equals 4"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 7"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> minutes. It is also known that after time <math alttext="t equals 7"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> minutes, the temperature of the object decreases an additional <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>. Which of the following statements is true about the amount of time the object will require to cool that additional <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: The object will require more than <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> minutes to cool that additional <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> because as <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> increases, the rates of change of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are negative and increasing toward <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>.

The object will require more than <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> minutes to cool that additional <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> because as <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> increases, the rates of change of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are negative and decreasing without bound.

The object will require fewer than <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> minutes to cool that additional <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> because as <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> increases, the rates of change of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are negative and increasing toward <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>.

The object will require fewer than <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> minutes to cool that additional <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> because as <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> increases, the rates of change of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are negative and decreasing without bound.

content.answer: The object will require more than <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> minutes to cool that additional <math alttext="10 degrees C"><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> because as <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> increases, the rates of change of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are negative and increasing toward <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>.
